member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.HealthCheckRegistration
member.summary: Represent the registration information associated with an implementation.

remarks.para: The health check registration is provided as a separate object so that application developers can customize how health check implementations are configured.

The registration is provided to an implementation during execution through . This allows a health check implementation to access named options or perform other operations based on the registered name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.HealthStatus
member.summary: Represents the reported status of a health check result.

remarks.para: A status of should be considered the default value for a failing health check. Application developers may configure a health check to report a different status as desired.
The values of this enum or ordered from least healthy to most healthy. So is greater than but less than .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.HealthStatus.Unhealthy
member.summary: Indicates that the health check determined that the component was unhealthy, or an unhandled exception was thrown while executing the health check.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.HealthStatus.Degraded
member.summary: Indicates that the health check determined that the component was in a degraded state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.HealthStatus.Healthy
member.summary: Indicates that the health check determined that the component was healthy.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.IHealthCheck
member.summary: Represents a health check, which can be used to check the status of a component in the application, such as a backend service, database or some internal state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.IHealthCheck.CheckHealthAsync(Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.HealthCheckContext,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Runs the health check, returning the status of the component being checked.
member.param: A context object associated with the current execution.
A that can be used to cancel the health check.
member.returns: A that completes when the health check has finished, yielding the status of the component being checked.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Diagnostics.HealthChecks.IHealthCheckPublisher
member.summary: Represents a publisher of information.

remarks.para: The default health checks implementation provided an IHostedService implementation that can be used to execute health checks at regular intervals and provide the resulting data to all registered instances.
To provide an implementation, register an instance or type as a singleton service in the dependency injection container.

instances are provided with a after executing health checks in a background thread. The use of depend on hosting in an application using IWebHost or generic host (IHost). Execution of instance is not related to execution of health checks via a middleware.

member.summary: Publishes the provided .
member.param: The . The result of executing a set of health checks.
The .
member.returns: A which will complete when publishing is complete.
